Package bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model

Class Patron

java.lang.Object
bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model.Patron
public class Patron extends Object
Patron class models a patron (member) of the library.
The class has fields for different patron properties such as name and phone number and has an id field that represents the patron's unique id in the library. In addition, the class has a list of the books that a patron has borrowed.
The class also offers getter and setter methods to get and set the values of the different properties and methods that allow for borrowing, returning and renewing books.

      public Patron(int id, String name, String phone, String email)
      Creates a new Patron instance.
      The constructor initialises a Patron object using the basic mandatory fields a patron should have to exist in the library
      Parameters:
      id - the patron's id.
      name - the patron's name
      phone - the patron's phone
      email - the patron's email

    • getDetailsLong

      public String getDetailsLong()
      Get a long and detailed description for the patron. The method prints the patron's id, name, publisher, phone number, email address and a list of all the books currently borrowed by the user.
      Returns:
      the patron's long description as a string.

    • getBooks

      public List<Book> getBooks()
      Get a list of books that the patron has borrowed.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of books that the patron has borrowed.

    • isBooksListEmpty

      public boolean isBooksListEmpty()
      Checks whether the book list is empty, which means whether the patron is borrowing anything currently.
      Returns:
      true if the book list is empty, otherwise false.

    • getNumberOfBorrowedBooks

      public int getNumberOfBorrowedBooks()
      Get the number of the books that is currently loaned to the patron.
      Returns:
      the number of books currently loaned the the patron as an integer.

    • borrowBook

      public void borrowBook(Book book, LocalDate dueDate) throws LibraryException
      Borrow a book from the library.
      The method creates a new Loan object that associates a book with the patron and updates the book with this loan information. The function also adds the book to the patron's list of borrowed books.
      If the book is on loan by another patron, an exception is thrown with a message saying that the book is currently on loan.
      Parameters:
      book - the book that will be borrowed by the patron.
      dueDate - the LocalDate value that will be set as the loan's due date.
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if the book is currently on loan to another patron.

    • renewBook

      public void renewBook(Book book, int numberOfDays)
      Renew the loan's due date for a book that is already on loan.
      The method changes (renews) the due date of a book that is currently on loan by the patron.
      If the book to be renewed is not on loan by the patron, an exception is thrown with a message saying that the book is not on loan to this patron.
      Parameters:
      book - the book to be renewed.
      numberOfDays - number of days that the loan will be extended for.

    • returnBook

      public void returnBook(Book book) throws LibraryException
      Renews the book from the patron's list of borrowed books.
      The method also terminates the loan by setting its return date and termination status.
      The method adds the returned book
      Parameters:
      book - the book to be returned to the library.
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if the book is not on loan to this patron.

    • addBook

      public void addBook(Book book) throws LibraryException
      Add a book to the patron's list of borrowed books.
      Parameters:
      book - the book to be added to the patron's list of borrowed books
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if the patron has exceeded the book limit.

    • removeFromLoanHistory

      public void removeFromLoanHistory(Loan loan) throws LibraryException
      The method removes a loan from the loanHistory array.
      The method is used when loan changes could not be stored in the text storage file and changes need to be undone.
      Parameters:
      loan - the loan object to be removed.
      Throws:
      LibraryException

    • removePatron

      public void removePatron()
      Deletes the patron by setting isHidden to true.

    • removeBook

      public void removeBook(Book book) throws LibraryException
      Removes the book from the patron's books list.
      This method is used when the borrow class is not able to store the data in the text storage files, and the changes need to be undone.
      Parameters:
      book - the book to be removed.
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if the book is not loaned by the patron.

    • reAddPatron

      public void reAddPatron()
      The method makes the patron visible again.
      The method is used when loan changes could not be stored in the text storage file and changes need to be undone.

    • addLoanToHistory

      public void addLoanToHistory(Loan loan)
      Adds a loan object the loanHistory array.
      Parameters:
      loan - the loan object to be added to the loanHistory array.

    • isRemoved

      public boolean isRemoved()
      Get the value of isHidden.
      Returns:
      true if the patron is supposed to be hidden and false otherwise.

    • getLoanHistory
